en.blogTitle: From an idea to a complete website - how the development process looks like?
en.aboutTheAuthor: Taking advantage of the existing business opportunities, I help the clients turn their visions into successful products through research and planning.
en.content:
But before, a quick note: the process broken down below is complete, but it doesn’t mean you cannot jump into it with an already prepared strategy or design concept. If you have a part of the work already done, we obviously won’t make you start all over again. Instead, we’ll try to make the best out of the provided materials.

I. The discovery phase

Once you reach out to us to consult your idea or concept, we won’t hop into designing right away. First, we need to put the pieces of information together to give the project a solid base. To do so, we should arrange at least one meeting. We can do it in person or online – it’s up to you. You can invite your business partners and project team if you feel that you’ll all benefit from it.

During the series of consultations, we set up the business goals assigned to this particular project. Relying on the available data, we analyze your existing audience or specify a target one, to fully understand its expectations and needs. That comes in handy when creating personas that facilitate the optimization of the interface and content. This way, we make sure that the final result will be as converting as it can.

What do we need at this point: an idea or a project outline (if you already have one)

What do we end up with: defined target audience, goals, and, in the end, a tailored strategy that will enable us to develop a refined website

How will we do it? Through a series of consulting sessions, brainstorming, and competition analysis

II. The planning phase

Now that we’ve specified which direction we want to head, we can pave the way to refined effect with thorough planning. This phase may seem the least energy-consuming, but we’d risk stating that the project’s success depends on it. It allows to organize the whole process and set up the expectations regarding deadlines and the exact budget.

What do we need at this point: A strategy that clearly points out the effect we want to achieve and the way to do it

What do we end up with: Project timeline, website structure, design concept

How will we do it: through consulting sessions, estimation & work management tools, and UX design methods such as wireframing and user journey mapping

III. Design

Now, that’s the phase we love the most! Seeing the concepts worked out during hours of brainstorming sessions materializing on the screen feels truly rewarding.

Even the most trendy interfaces won’t serve their purpose without a thoughtfully designed structure and navigation. But the trends matter too – there is no doubt about that! We will try to stay in line with some of them, while maintaining a distinctive character of the website and adding elements that will make it stand out. If you want to know more about the leading tendencies in UI/UX design, check our article.

2D or 3D? Typical static website or an interactive project that includes motion graphics? One showcase webpage or a multi-page structured project? If you’re not sure what direction to take, we can figure it out together.

 

What do we need at this point: A general concept of the website: aesthetics, wireframes, architecture, user experience

What do we end up with: Refined interface designed to the smallest detail: color palette, typography, background, spacing, icons, widgets, illustrations, animations, and everything else necessary to construct a beautiful website.

How will we do it: using design tools such as Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, Animate, etc.

IV. Development

Once we’ve got all this concept captured in visual elements, it’s time to bring it into life with the code. If you decide to go with the static website, the mix of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript will be just enough. However, in the case of interactive interfaces, we’ll need to work on the back end as well.

Polishing that side is essential for e-commerce websites and web apps based on interactions. It’s not just any code – the choice of a back-end framework determines the website’s performance. We’re flexible in this respect, using Node JS, JavaScript, and Ruby – just to name a few. Considering that smartphone users are beginning to take over the market, we’ll make sure that your website is optimized for mobile interfaces, too.

What do we need at this point: a complete project with all the static elements designed, verified and accepted by the contractor

What do we end up with: a coded website that works seamlessly on mobile and desktop interfaces

How will we do it: with appropriately selected coding frameworks (Next.js, React/react native, Graph.ql, Node.js, Typescript, Ruby, JavaScript)

What sets our approach apart?

At Explayn, we put emphasis on versatility without compromising the quality of any project’s segment. Knowing that the cooperation of a few outsourced teams can result in delays and communication disruptions, we’ve decided to deliver an alternative. The one-step solution can eliminate these problems and increase the coherency of the brand’s visual identity and voice. Instead of spreading the work between few companies, you can choose one that handles both the design and development process and taking care of branding and the marketing strategy.
en.leadText: When searching for a reliable development partner, it's not uncommon to get discouraged after looking through the few first landing pages. A lot of jargon and not much content - in a nutshell, that's what the problem comes down to. The development process can adopt slightly different forms, but generally, its components are fixed. Today, we‚Äôd like to show you how we do it in Explayn, using a transparent vocabulary and placing its stages on a timeline. The article may help you understand its intricacies and give you an idea of its proper course. Without further ado, let's take a closer look at it!

messages.torbasmaku.case-about.p1: Firma, z kt√≥rƒÖ pracowali≈õmy, specjalizuje siƒô w dostarczaniu zestaw√≥w posi≈Çk√≥w opartych na wcze≈õniej przygotowanych planach ≈ºywieniowych. messages.torbasmaku.case-about.p3: Przy uruchamianiu tego projektu, naszymi g≈Ç√≥wnymi celami by≈Çy m.in:
messages.torbasmaku.case-about.li1: stworzenie sp√≥jnego wizerunku lidera w kategorii tanich us≈Çug cateringowych
messages.torbasmaku.case-about.li2: uruchomienie sprzeda≈ºy i jej rozw√≥j w kr√≥tkim czasie.
messages.torbasmaku.case-work-subject.p1: Wziƒôli≈õmy aktywny udzia≈Ç w procesie budowania marki od podstaw, pomagajƒÖc naszemu klientowi wprowadziƒá firmƒô na rynek. W kilku krokach, kt√≥re pokr√≥tce opiszemy poni≈ºej, stworzyli≈õmy platformƒô internetowƒÖ, identyfikacjƒô wizualnƒÖ oraz strategiƒô marketingowƒÖ, kt√≥ra nastƒôpnie zosta≈Ça wdro≈ºona z zadowalajƒÖcym skutkiem.
messages.torbasmaku.case-work-subject.p2: Pierwszym krokiem by≈Ço stworzenie platformy do zamawiania spersonalizowanych zestaw√≥w posi≈Çk√≥w. messages.torbasmaku.case-work-project.p1: TworzƒÖc ten projekt, musieli≈õmy pamiƒôtaƒá o specyfice bran≈ºy gastronomicznej.
